description: This year's Lasker Prize for public service goes to South African researchers Salim and Quarraisha Abdool-Karim. The married couple made a startling discovery about HIV — and did something about it.
title: 'America's Nobel' goes to a power couple who made a startling discovery about HIV

description:
Israel began a series of attacks against the Lebanese militant group Hezbollah with pagers and walkie talkies that exploded. They then launched airstrikes targeting the group's leadership. One strike killed Hezbollah's leader of over thirty years, Hassan Nasrallah. The attacks are an effort to prevent Hezbollah from continuing to fire rockets at northern Israel, which it has been doing since the war in Gaza began. Israel's airstrikes are continuing to widen and their military is massing at the border, pointing to a possible ground invasion.

We'll hear from our correspondent in Beirut about the feeling on the ground there. We also hear about whether and how Iran might respond. Iran had been arming Hezbollah to counter Israel, and the weakening of the group is a blow to an important proxy of Iran's.

For more coverage of all sides of this conflict, go to npr.org/mideastupdates
title: Israel Widens Its Airstrikes in Lebanon, How Will Iran Respond?

description: Two federal programs that helped federal student loan borrowers ease back into payments are ending. It will have the biggest impact on borrowers with defaulted loans or borrowers who miss payments moving forward.
title: Two major student loan grace periods are set to expire this week. Here's what to know

description: Vice President Harris made her comments during a wide-ranging conversation with former NBA stars Stephen Jackson and Matt Barnes for their podcast All the Smoke.
title: Harris talks about marijuana and racial identity in 'All the Smoke' interview

description: Spruce Pine is a major global supplier of high-purity quartz. It’s an essential ingredient for microchips and solar panels.
title: A tiny town just got slammed by Helene. It could massively disrupt the tech industry

description: In the American West, white glaciers and snow fields are outnumbered by long-overlooked “rock glaciers.” The rock covering these vast hunks of ice makes them far less affected by warming temperatures.
title: Why the most climate-resistant glaciers are hiding in plain sight

description: Shackled and dressed in khaki prison garb at a hearing in West Palm Beach, Fla., Routh also requested a jury trial. He faces four other charges, such as possession of a firearm by a convicted felon.
title: Ryan Routh pleads not guilty to attempting to assassinate former President Donald Trump

description: Israeli commandos are conducting limited intelligence-gathering raids inside southern Lebanon, and that there are indications that Israel will be carrying out a limited ground incursion.
title: Israel conducts intel raids in southern Lebanon ahead of a possible ground invasion

description: There are fewer tents on San Francisco sidewalks. The city has ramped up enforcement of anti-camping laws, and police are playing a bigger role.
title: San Francisco ramps up policing of homeless camps, with the Supreme Court's blessing

description: In a pair of weekend events in key swing states, Trump claimed Harris is "mentally disabled" and went on to suggest police violence could curb crime.
title: Trump turns to darker rhetoric as voting begins

description: Tropical storm Helene has left western North Carolina with catastrophic damage from historic flooding to a loss of power for thousands. And, Lebanon mourning the loss of Hezbollah leader.
title: Historic flooding strands hundreds in North Carolina. And, Hezbollah leader mourned

description: Most Americans support allowing some terminally ill patients to end their own lives. But a Maryland bill’s narrow defeat shows the issue is still religiously fraught and politically delicate.
title: Maryland seemed poised this year to legalize medical aid in dying. What happened?

description: The CBS News vice presidential debate will be the only time Ohio Sen. JD Vance and Minnesota Gov. Tim Walz get to face off ahead of the 2024 election. Here's what to expect.
title: Vance and Walz debate in New York City on Tuesday. Here’s what you need to know

description: Is Georgia ready to cast its 16 electoral votes for a woman for president? We put that question to three women who have lived through a few election cycles in the state.
title: 3 women from different backgrounds detail why they're voting for Harris

description: Life is stressful. Whether it’s work or relationship issues or you’re worrying about politics or global conflict, it can be overwhelming. NPR’s Stress Less: A quest to reclaim your calm aims to help.
title: Stressed out? These 8 skills can help boost mood and reduce anxiety

description: Talking to historian and author Robert Caro is like stepping into a time machine, as NPR discovered on a visit to his New York office recently.
title: 'The Power Broker' at 50 — and what author Robert Caro is still uncovering

description: Those who’ve debated Walz before say he has a down-to-earth style that is relatable to voters — but it's an approach that can also cause problems for the Democratic vice presidential nominee.
title: What Tim Walz's past debate performances reveal about how he may take on JD Vance

description: People trust information more when it comes from sources or contexts they’re familiar with. Help counter misinformation in your community by having conversations with your friends and family.
title: To combat misinformation, start with connection, not correction

description: The first apparent Israeli airstrike on central Beirut in nearly a year of conflict leveled an apartment building early Monday. It came after Israel hit targets across Lebanon and killed dozens of people.
title: An airstrike hits a Beirut residential building as Israel expands attacks in Lebanon

description: The Freedom Party on Sunday secured the first far-right national parliamentary election victory in post-World War II Austria. But political rivals have said they won’t work with the party's leader.
title: Austrian far-right party wins national vote but its chances of governing are unclear
